Title: The Man Who Mistook His Wife for a Hat
Author: Oliver Sacks
Reason1: I enjoy the writing style of Oliver Sacks.
Reason2: This is a book of interesting case studies.
Reason3: This book was gifted to me by one of my former mentors.

Title: Clinical Psychopharmacology Made Ridiculously Simple
Author: John Preston, James Johnson
Reason1: I used this book through a challenging Psychopharmacology course in college.
Reason2: It's written in a humorous style.
Reason3: I got an A in the class!

Title: When Breath Becomes Air
Author: Paul Kalanithi
Reason1: This is an autobiography by neurosurgeon, Dr. Paul Kalanithi, with worsening lung cancer.
Reason2: It helped me navigate the death of a loved one with cancer.
Reason3: It's one of the most beautiful books I have ever read and is very special to me.
